name: exportable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be sent to another country for sale: Their economy produces few exportable goods.
(of something from a particular country) able to be used in other countries: The value of the new television technology to the company is that it is highly exportable.
(of information from a computer) able to be copied to a different part of the computer's memory or to another computer device: The formats should be exportable to any format.
More examplesFewer examplesChanges in trade and monetary policy promoted the production of exportable crops.They produced 150 million bushels of exportable surplus.The French model of football isn't necessarily exportable.The teams are partaking of that Anglo-Irish - but eminently exportable - tradition known as the pub quiz.The data should be exportable in a standard, common, supported format.
